[Repost. Pardon the =3D20s and =3D2Es]

Since static methods cannot be enfo=
rced in an interface, can you just
change the static methods to something n=
on-static? Answering the question,=3D

"Why are these methods class level?"=
 is the first step to a better
design=3D2E=3D

Perhaps you have another obj=
ect creeping around in there, trying to get
out=3D2E Until that object gets=
 out, mocking will be hellish=3D2E

If someone is calling the static method=
, they are definitely not doing it
through the ITaskGroup interface, so ign=
ore the interface for the purposes=3D

of this discussion=3D2E Extract an o=
bject from the collection of static meth=3D
ods
and mock that new object=3D=
2E

Good luck=3D2E

creating MockObjects from Classes that use Static Me=
thods=3D2E

e=3D2Eg=3D2E=3D20

public class TaskGroup implements ITaskGroup=
 {
 =3D20
  public static void execute() {
    // Implementation of method
=
  }

  // =3D2E=3D2E=3D2E
  //=3D20

E=3D2E
  //=3D20
  // =3D2E=3D2E=3D2E=3D20

}


In this case a MockObject m=
ust extend TaskGroup instead of=3D20
implementing ITaskGroup=3D2E =3D20

Is=
 this the only way to go about creating MockObjects from such=3D20
classes?=
  Is there a refactoring pattern I could employ that would=3D20
allow me to=
 Mock the Interface instead of the Concreate Class?

I have considered plac=
ing all static methods in an abstract TaskGroup=3D20
and causing each metho=
d to immediately throw a=3D20
java=3D2Elang=3D2EUnsupportedOperation Except=
ion=3D2E  This allows me to create =3D
a=3D20
MockObject from the abstract =
class (i=3D2Ee=3D2E The mockobject does not=3D20
extend the domain code) bu=
t this approach strikes me as very=3D20
questionable design=3D2E

ciate any suggestions, web links or general abuse=3D2E
